name: preempt
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to prevent something from happening by taking action first: State laws preempted local governments from restricting newspaper displays.
If a broadcast is preempted, it is replaced by another, usually more important broadcast: One station preempted its Friday night schedule to televise the high school playoffs.
preemptive adjective [ not gradable ] (also pre-emptive) us
Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/priˈemp·tɪv/
a preemptive air strike on an enemy base
